website_summaries.verdict: A good option for a Thunderbolt 3 docking station for gaming and graphic design.
pros: Dual Thunderbolt 3 docks support video output for 4K monitor setups
Single DisplayPort is also capable of 5K output
cons: Some laptops require a display driver update to use the docking station correctly

website_summaries.verdict: This dock performs well and has the ability to not only lock, but be used with several connecting units.
pros: Includes a Gigabit Ethernet and a USB 3.0 dock
Up to 5 thunderbolt devices can be connected together
Designed to be mounted to the back of a monitor to reduce footprint on your desk
cons: This model includes a power cable and a Thunderbolt 3 cable, but you will have to provide all other connection cables yourself

customer_reviews.title: Kensington is a class company.
customer_reviews.text: I learned about Kensington early on when I was looking for decent Mice that were not meant to be tossed away. Their Thunderbolt 3 docking station was the 3rd attempt at a product that promised a lot but didn't deliver much. To be honest, non-apple (windows based) laptops took a a long time to include a truly functional thunderbolt 3 port. Luckily, Razer was ahead of the power curve. Luckily, "threes the charm" as the saying goes. Out of the box to fully functional...would you believe 10 minutes. Everything worked on the first try. Amazing! Thanks for making this plug and play, instead of plug and pray! cb
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Becker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't function as a hub. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 monitors connected to my HP laptop at my desk. I purchased this hub to reduce the number of cables I have to plug in everyday to connect my laptop. This unit does not function as a hub as I have to plug in just as many cables to my laptop in order to get everything to function. The unit does not charge my laptop, the unit does not run 2 monitors, the unit does not allow for printer connectivity. I basically have this plugged in to run an extra USB port and one monitor. It is useless, and the seller will not accept a return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good TB3 docking solution.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this dock for my Dell Precision 5530 laptop. I have dual QHD monitors attached with one connected to the displayport and the other from the USB C port with an adapter cable (Plugable USB C to DisplayPort Adapter Cable). Everything functions properly with the exception of the power delivery/charging over the TB cable. The 5530 uses a 180 Watt power adapter and the Kensington dock is rated @ 85 Watts. Not a big deal for me, as I was aware of the charging limitation before my purchase. The Kensington TB3 dock wasn't loaded with Vine reviews, which is primarily why I purchased this over other models.
customer_reviews.author: RmF

customer_reviews.title: Best of both worlds (PC & Mac)
customer_reviews.text: I use this for both my work (windows laptop) and macbook pro 2018. I don't have 4k monitors, so can't really comment on screen quality, but it works for my needs. All ports work and have not had any issues. My work issued dell dock had issues waking up the laptop sometimes, but this one works without fail. Glad i invested into this, instead of having 2 docking stations for work and personal laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K.

customer_reviews.title: PRO: MOUNTS 2 BUS-POWERED DRIVES / CON: REFUSES WRITE PERMISSION ON DRIVES
customer_reviews.text: The good is that I can now power 2 monitors or 2 bus-powered USB hard drives. - Great. The BAD... is that while reading footage files (I edit video) works fine... I cannot SAVE or WRITE files to my drives. - If I remove those same drives and plug them in one at a time to my other docks... they WRITE just fine. - Kensington does NOT have firmware updates for this device on their website. - Bad ju-ju. - I need and update that fixes my write permissions. - Then I can change my review.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Spanky Of Nazareth

customer_reviews.title: Does not support dual 4K monitors with macbook pro,  unless you are OK with Default resolutions
customer_reviews.text: Does not support dual 4K monitors with 2018 Macbook pro, unless you are OK with Default resolutions. Call their Tech Support, and they tried to help, but unfortunately this unit die not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: RAJ K NATHAN

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quality dock for a MacBook Pro 15" so that I could keep it cleanly off to the side while working with external monitor/keyboard/mouse. Been using this for a few weeks and it fit the bill perfectly. A single thunderbolt cable provides networking, external monitor, USB, and power. I was also able to connect a DVI monitor to it via a thunderbolt to DVI adapter without issue. Construction feels high quality. The only downside here is perhaps the cost, but for serious/professional use it's probably worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Tantalus

customer_reviews.title: SuperThunderbolt 3 Dock
customer_reviews.text: The Kensington SD5200T is compact and feature-packed. It may not have as many USB ports as others. But, it has 85W of charging power which is more important to me. I connect a 5K monitor, audio, and Thunderbolt 3 disk arrays with 40GBS speed. And, it has two ports on the front. I like it and use it daily. Many other Thunderbolt 3 docks do not have 85W charging power.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ching

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't charging my new 2018 Macbook Pro
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this dock, I thought it was great, then I started noticing that it wasn't charging my MacBook Pro. Any kind of light to medium load on my 2018 MacBook Pro caused the dock to stop charging it. What a waste of money. The worst purchase ever!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BradO

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Thunderbolt 3 dock
customer_reviews.text: This is the dock that solved all of my Macbook Pro (2018) problems. I had tried other docks but they had problems when I would put the Macbook Pro into the Bootcamp mode. The Kensington SD5200T solved the problem. I only wish that it had more than 1 USB-A port on the back of the unit. That would make it truly versatile. I would surely buy again if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Wideglide

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed and constant headaches.
customer_reviews.text: This hardware and the Intel thunderbolt app are absolute garbage. It should be plug n play, but I had all kinds of issues setting it up. Wouldn't register my mouse and keyboard when plugged in. Had to troubleshoot for like 2 hours. Then it started browning out and would turn on and off constantly. Finally got it working then went on a business trip. Now that I'm back we're back to square one. Keyboard and mouse don't work AGAIN. Now I have to waste my time troubleshooting this garbage again.
customer_reviews.author: SeanC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: i really wanted this dock to work, i've been looking forward to the one cable solution for video, accessories, and charging, but it frequently just makes the video lose connection and is really unreliable. I've tried changing cables and switching between the display port and usb c ports, but its the same issue. Eventually i just get fustrated enough to just hook the hdmi to usb-c cable to my macbook, but i could've bought a cheaper dock to handle just the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: C. Distler

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Mac, not for my PC
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to the SD5200T from an SD5000T as I needed to timeshare it between a macbook pro and a Dell Latitude 5590. Works great with the Macbook, just as the SD5000T did, but doesn't work at all with the Dell PC. It powers it, but the Dell doesn't recognize any of the connections - speakers, ethernet, 4K monitor, webcam. So, I spent a lot of money for nothing, basically. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Your results may vary...
customer_reviews.text: Product did not drive 2 4K monitors as mentioned in the product description. My Dell 2717D flickered when connected via Display Port.
customer_reviews.author: Kentaro Suzuki

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised... now just one USB-C cable to my MacBook
customer_reviews.text: Life with my MacBook was a mess of USB cables and adapters before this. Now one USB-C to the MacBook and the rest of the mess plugged in to this. Powers everything. I have 2 4K displays plus the MacBook display all working fine. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Worked from first plug in
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this docking station with a 2018 MacBook Pro for about 1.5 months now with zero issues. All components just worked when they were plugged in. I am running a 24" Samsung display via Display Port, another 22" Samsung display via a USB-C to DVI adapter, and a USB Mouse/Keyboard combo. Would recommend to anyone looking for a docking station to run external monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Zero issues. Plug and play with zero configuration or manual steps needed. I'm using it with a MacbookPro, ethernet, usb wired apple keyboard+connected usb mouse, and a 1440p asus monitor via displayport. Also works with my MacbookAir. Definitely worth the price as there are a lot cheaper docks that either don't work or don't properly support the 1440p resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with laptop Dell and MacPro dual screen
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunate I need to return it ; specification is weak and it is not working with my laptop and Mac ; the design is really poor for a doc station - and the ports setup is really bad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honest Review: Great Thunderbolt Dock
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for a Thunderbolt 3 Dock for a while to connect all my studio equipment to my MacBook Pro. This dock works really well. The power delivery allows you to not have to use the power cord that came with the laptop. The dock can power the 15" Mac Book Pro by itself.
customer_reviews.author: RoRo Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Works decently well with Bootcamp.
customer_reviews.text: The Elgato definitely has better fit and finish, but this one seems to work better with a 2017 MacBook Pro 13 w/ Touch Bar running Bootcamp. If you're not running BootCamp I'd probably go for the Elgato. For both it helped to update the display drivers on the bootcamp side of things on Intel's website. Would've given it 5 Stars had the fit and finish been like that of Elgato.
customer_reviews.author: SF-NP

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating. Doesn't work well with my windows laptop or macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: Got this dock so I could easily switch between my macbook and my windows laptop I use for work. Monitor never connects with the Windows machine. And monitor connection only works sometimes with my macbook. Sometimes unplugging it and plugging it back in it will work. Cannot charge macbook with dock. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sienna Salo

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Home Office
customer_reviews.text: Allows me to use dual monitors and keep charged up. Also has nice room for other peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: CNorris

customer_reviews.title: decent
customer_reviews.text: good value, does drop a monitor when going into sleep mode on my mac. Doesn't do it all the time but requires me to reconnect the thunderbolt connection. Other than that functions well.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This dock works flawlessly between the current USB-C based MacBook ...
customer_reviews.text: This dock works flawlessly between the current USB-C based MacBook Pro with OS X & PC's with Microsoft Windows 10. It is an outstanding solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Info Tech

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works amazingly! Syncs up with my Mac as it should and I am able to have multiple monitors. It’s really nice how it has an integrated power supply. And I would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works with dual monitors!
customer_reviews.text: High Sierra broke the dual monitor functionality of our previous docking station. The Kensington SD5200T uses a different technology and works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: neutronx

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding performance and it really switches seamless from PC to Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R. Deida Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I am using this dock for connecting two 4K monitors, a headset, and other peripherals to my MacBook Pro and Lenovo ThinkPad. In both cases, the product has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: James Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Works well with MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Installed effortlessly. Does not interrupt wireless service like the other brand I was using. Only mess up I had when ordering is that I did not notice that the hdmi connection was hdmi ++. $18 connector fixed that.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for Macbook Pro 2018...When it works
customer_reviews.text: Returning one of them as the second usb c port on the back does not work. Macbook sees monitor connected but will not display. I'm using a USB c to HDMI adapter. Replaced adapter with another one and still have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Verge

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do the job for 2019 MBP
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2019 Macbook Pro, A1990 EMC 3359, the one with the Touch Bar. The charger that comes with it is 87W. In theory this dock supplies 85W so you'd think it would work, but slowly over the course of a work day the battery drains and eventually before 5pm the machine shuts off. I tried two other things that didn't work either--I plugged in headphones to listen to a webcast, and the headphones didn't work; I tried to use my Yubikey in a USB-A port on the dock and that didn't work either. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Connery

customer_reviews.title: $240 laptop charger
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2018 Macbook Pro (the one with all the USB-C ports). It seemed to work OK for about a month but then I started having numerous problems. Sometimes it would lock up my laptop if I closed the lid while attached. Other times, when I woke the laptop from a lock-screen, the displayport monitor wouldn't turn back on unless I rebooted the dock. Finally, the one USB-C monitor jack on the back died. I now use this dock just to charge my laptop. At least it still does that, for now.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Hardly Works
customer_reviews.text: My company bought a bunch of these for a whole group of employees who just received new laptops. These things are terrible. Almost everyone who has one has issues. The USB ports fail to connect for most people. Most of us have gone back to using USB hubs. I basically use mine for a glorified DisplayPort connection since that's about the only thing that works on it. It's pretty sad that something that costs this much works so terribly.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this dock, but the "two monitors" promise is a lie. You end up with the second screen flashing/dropping out all the time so instead of having to plug in just one cable I'm back to plugging in two. Additionally the monitor that's plugged into the main TB3 port doesn't seem to wake up from sleep anymore, so I might end up having to plug in another cable to stop that from being annoying. Turns out this might just an expensive power supply + USB hub instead of a dock.
customer_reviews.author: Damien B

customer_reviews.title: Often have a freeze on my macbook when unplugging
customer_reviews.text: Overall works well. However I experience two issues: When plugging in of my monitors not coming on (have to unplug and replug the montior on the docking station. When unplugging my Macbook is frozen. (about 5% chance). Since I often go to meetings I experience it every 2 days or so. I have to hard power down the macbook pro to get any functionality back.
customer_reviews.author: Reto E.

customer_reviews.title: How to fix the buggy issues
customer_reviews.text: PSA for those having buggy issues. The included TB3 cable is the problem. I use this on a 2018 MBP and Razer blade stealth daily and the included cable was the issue. I asked our tech support team as work for a cable matters TB3 cable and I haven’t had any issues since. Even works well with monitors others have been reporting as non compatible once you switch the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinions

customer_reviews.title: Reliability issue
customer_reviews.text: I own three sd5200t, two of them dead now. One Keeps turning screen on and off and on and off and on and off. Another one won’t get recognized at all. Only about one and a half year
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Problems with MacOS 10.14.4 and Drivers 5.1.1
customer_reviews.text: It seems that the latest MacOS release has broken the dual display issue. Up until then things were working well. Problem occurs when you disconnect your laptop and then reconnect, you will often not detect the second display I reported this issue to their support last week with no follow up. I like the product, I hope they are able to fix this in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: David Low

product_meta.title: Kensington SD5200T Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station - 170 Watts with Power Delivery - Dual Monitor 4k for Mac and PC (K38300NA)
product_meta.description: Kensington has engineered the game-changing SD5200T Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station for Windows and Mac. Whether you're a video editor, graphic designer, content creator, gamer, or just someone who wants to simplify a 4K workspace, you get more speed, more pixels, more power, and more possibilities. The SD5200T Thunderbolt 3 Docking Station is a power user's solution for hyper-productivity. For over 35 years, Kensington has been The Professionals' Choice for desktop productivity Q: Is there a setup and usage video? A: Yes, at the left side of the page with the collection of images; also view it at customer. Kensington/a/328383. Q: Does the SD5200t docking station work with both Windows and Mac OS?A: Yes: Does this dock require new driver installation on my computer? A: We recommend you ensure that your computer’s Thunderbolt 3 driver is the most up to date version. Q: Does this dock support USB-C Power Delivery (PD)?A: Yes, the dock supports USB-C Power Delivery through the Thunderbolt 3 connector, up to 85W. Your laptop of course needs to accept Power Delivery over USB-C. Q: Can I use a non-Thunderbolt 3 USB-C cable with this dock? A: The cable used for the dock must be an Intel-certified Thunderbolt 3 cable. A . 5m Intel-certified TB3 cable is included. Longer cables can cause performance issues. If you lose or damage the included cable, our can check the official Thunderbolt website for certified cables. Q: Is this Thunderbolt 3 dock backwards compatible with a non-Thunderbolt 3 USB-C port, Thunderbolt 1 or 2 ports, or a USB-A portal: No. Q: Does the USB-C port on the front of the dock support video over USB-C?A: The front USB-C port is a data-only port and supports 5V/3A (15W). Q: What video standards are supported through this dock? A: The Display Port connector on the dock supports DP v1. 2 + + , or Display Port dual-mode, where passive cabling to Display Port, HDMI, and DVI standards are allowed. The Thunderbolt 3 ports are fully compatible to USB-C Display Port Alt mode standards, where a USB-C to video adapter can be used to connect to a second monitor. We recommend using Kensington CV4000H USB-C to HDMI adapter (K33993WW) or CV2000V USB-C to VGA adapter (K33994WW). Q: What is the maximum resolution supported by the dock? A: Up to two monitors at 4K/60Hz: both the Display Port connector and the Thunderbolt 3 ports support Display Port v1. 2 standards of 4096 x 2160 @ 60Hz. The dock can also support a single 5K/60Hz monitor. Typically, the 5K monitor would use two Display Port inputs to achieve this; alternatively you can use the dock’s Display Port plus one of the dock’s Thunderbolt 3 ports to a monitor’s Display Port input (using a USB-C to Display Port cable or adapter). To support 4K @ 60Hz, ensure that Display Port 1. 2 or MST (multi-stream support) is enabled on your display. Q: What should I do if I am getting inconsistent video performance when the dock is connected to a 4K monitor at 4K resolution? A: The video performance may be affected by the quality of the Display Port cable used in the setup when using 4K resolution. We recommend that the user try a different cable to see if the problem persists. A cable less than 1. 5M in length is desired. Q: Why is the audio still coming out of the laptop instead of the external speakers/headset that I connected to dock? A: Sometimes the computer will not automatically make the audio channel coming out of the dock as the default. In this case go to Mac OS: System Preferences - Sound - Output, and select USB Audio as the default audio channel.
feature_bullets: Thunderbolt 3 dock for MacBook Pro, MacBook Air 2018 W/Retina Display, and Windows supports Dual 4K Ultra HD (4096 x 2160 30-bit color @ 60 Hz), or 5K 60fps TO a single monitor.
Delivers 85W power to charge your laptop (Laptop must be designed to support power Delivery via Thunderbolt to provide charging); . 5 meter Intel Certified TB3 cable included.

Two Thunderbolt 3 ports (for dual monitor setup, one of the TB3 ports will be used for the second display via a USB-C to DisplayPort on the monitor); one DisplayPort; 15W USB C port; Dual USB 3. 0 Ports (one with a 2. 1a charging port); Gigabit Ethernet port; 3. 5mm headphone and microphone jacks; Kensington Lock slot.

To avoid the monitor flickering issues on the above monitor models, you can run Dual 4K monitors at 30Hz by using one of these solutions: 1) change the monitor setting to DP 1. 1 instead of 1. 2; 2) change the monitor input resolution to 4K/30Hz. Otherwise, you can run a single 4K display with any of the Above monitors by not using the display port on the dock, but by using one of the TB3 ports with a USB-C to HDMI cable.

Zero Footprint Mounting provides the option to attach the dock to the back of any VESA-compatible monitor (VESA mounting plate sold separately, part# K33959WW); Industry leading 3yr and lifetime technical support.

The following monitors should not be used with 4k/60hz resolution and our Thunderbolt 3 dock due to Display Port ++ compatibility issues (common to all TB3 docks with Display Port ++): LG 31MU97C-B, LG 24UD58-B, LG 27UD58-B; Dell P2715Q, P2415Q, UP3216Q; Asus PB287Q, PQ321Q; View Sonic VX2475Smhl-4K, VX43804K; Samsung U28E590D; Philips 288P6LJEB; Sharp PN-K321; See below in the faq’s for solutions.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars66 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
